author: Staff Reporter
text:
Left Front has lodged a complaint against Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to the Election Commission for making “threatening” remarks against the Opposition in an interview to a television channel.

A delegation led by Communist Party of India-Marxist leader Rabin Deb alleged that by saying “that three days after the Assembly polls, the Central forces will leave and the State government will be in charge,” Ms. Banerjee issued a veiled threat to the Opposition.

“We have also submitted the CD of the Chief Minister’s interview to the Commission,” Mr. Deb told journalists on Saturday after the all-party meeting with the Chief Electoral Officer Sunil Gupta. He also criticised Trinamool Congress vice-president Mukul Roy for saying the Trinamool would return to power with a “two-third majority.”
title: Left lodges complaint with EC against Mamata
